concept.title: Materials for Typewriter Ribbon Replacement
concept.shortdesc: There are a few essential and optional materials required to replace your typewriter ribbon and maintain cleanliness.

ul.li: Typewriter – The mechanical device that uses an inked ribbon to transfer characters onto paper.

New ink ribbon – The source of ink used for producing visible text on paper.
Most typewriters are compatible with universal ribbons. However, model-specific requirements such as ribbon size, spool diameter, or cassette format may apply, especially for older or electric typewriters.
Gloves – Protective coverings such as nitrile, latex, or plastic gloves that prevent ink stains during contact with saturated ribbon surfaces.
Paper towels or cleaning cloth – Absorbent materials used to remove residual ink from the typewriter interior or surrounding surfaces.
